title: 272-B
statement: B. Dima and Sequencetime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutDima got into number sequences. Now he's got sequencea1,a2, ...,an, consisting ofnpositive integers. Also, Dima has got a functionf(x), which can be defined with the following recurrence:f(0) = 0;f(2·x) =f(x);f(2·x+ 1) =f(x) + 1.Dima wonders, how many pairs of indexes(i,j)(1 ≤i<j≤n)are there, such thatf(ai) =f(aj). Help him, count the number of such pairs.InputThe first line contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 105). The second line containsnpositive integersa1,a2, ...,an(1 ≤ai≤ 109).The numbers in the lines are separated by single spaces.OutputIn a single line print the answer to the problem.Please, don't use the%lldspecifier to read or write 64-bit integers inC++. It is preferred to use thecin,coutstreams or the%I64dspecifier.ExamplesInput31 2 4Output3Input35 3 1Output1NoteIn the first sample any pair(i,j)will do, so the answer is3.In the second sample only pair(1, 2)will do.

processed.result:
You are given a sequence of $n$ positive integers.  Define a function $f(x)$ as follows:

* $f(0) = 0$
* $f(2x) = f(x)$
* $f(2x + 1) = f(x) + 1$

Count the number of pairs of indices $(i, j)$ where $1 \le i < j \le n$ and $f(a_i) = f(a_j)$. 

Input:

* The first line contains an integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 10⁵).
* The second line contains $n$ positive integers $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$ (1 ≤ $a_i$ ≤ 10⁹).

Output:

* Print a single line containing the count of valid pairs.
You are given a sequence of numbers.  For each number in the sequence, calculate a value based on a specific rule. Count how many pairs of numbers in the sequence have the same calculated value.
